III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
1

(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Last night, a staff member shoved a youth when they were trying
to go out the door. This has happened numerous times.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on October 29,
2024, and reported they had no additional information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
November 14, 2024. Youth A denied any staff ever pushing or
pulling him. Youth A acknowledged knowing Staff 1 however
denied him ever pushing or shoving him in or out of a door, stating
he is “a good staff”. Youth A denied ever having staff hurt him in
any way at Clarence Fischer Center.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
November 14, 2024. Youth B said he has been placed on a unit
two different times in the last few months with Youth A. Youth B
said he has never seen Youth A or any other youth pushed, pulled,
or shoved around by staff. Youth B said Youth A has never told him
about being pushed or pulled by a staff. Youth B said Staff 1 works
with him and he does not have any concerns about him.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
November 14, 2024. Staff 1 said he started at Clarence Fischer
Center the end of October and mainly works second shift. Staff 1
said he has worked many shifts with Youth A. Staff 1 denied ever
pushing or pulling Youth A out of the door. Staff 1 denied ever
seeing anyone push or pull Youth A. Staff 1 said Youth A has
walked off the unit and his response has always been to verbally
redirect and follow him if possible.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
November 14, 2024. Staff 2 said he has worked many shifts on
Youth A’s unit and has worked with Staff 1. Staff 2 denied ever
seeing Staff 1 or any other staff push, shove, or pull Youth A. Staff
2 denied having any concerns with Staff 1’s interactions with
youth. Staff 2 denied Youth A disclosing being pushed or pulled by
staff.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
November 14, 2024. Staff 3 said he works first shift and has not
2

worked with Staff 1. Staff 3 denied seeing or having knowledge of
any staff pushing or pulling Youth A. Staff 3 denied Youth A ever
disclosing being pushed or hurt by any staff.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
November 14, 2024. Staff 4 said she normally works second shift
and has worked with Staff 1 on several occasions. Staff 4 said she
has never seen or heard of Staff 1 or any other staff pushing or
pulling Youth A around. Staff 4 said Youth A has never told her he
has been pushed or hurt by staff. Staff 4 said she does not have
any concerns about the way Staff 1 interacts with the youth.
Case Manager was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
November 14, 2024. Case Manager said he is the case manager
for Youth A and meets with him individually at least weekly. Case
Manager denied Youth A ever disclosing being pushed or pulled
by a staff member. Case Manager said he goes on the units on
and off throughout the day and has never seen Staff 1 or any
other staff push or pull Youth A. Case Manager said he has
witnessed Staff 1 interacting with the youth and does not have any
concerns with him.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of October 28, 2024, unit three, was reviewed on
November 5, 2024. The footage shows Youth A walking across the
unit and out the backdoor and the door shuts. Staff 1 is seen
following Youth A across the unit and opens the door, walks out,
holding the door open. Youth A is seen walking back into the unit
and Staff 1 follows back into the unit.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews and video review, staff did not push or pull Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
